intro: Arthrobotrya brightiae, commonly known as the Bright's brittlestem, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is a lichenized fungus that forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provides it with nutrients through photosynthesis. The plant is characterized by its brittle, branching structure and a distinctive yellowish to orange coloration. It is typically found on rocky surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and fragile nature, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
